issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/master/INSTALL text file provides instructions on how to get, build, and deploy Eucalyptus from source code. (Just the community https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus code, not the rest of the "internal" repos) However, it is out of date and incomplete, and now contains errors because it hasn't been updated as changes in the build/deploy process have changed.

I've gone through that process, and with help from others, improved the file and fixed problems along the way. You can now follow it to clone the code, install dependencies for CentOS 6.7, build RPMs using "rpmbuild", and rebuild with either "rpmbuild" or "make" commands.

{noformat}
INSTALL Instructions, Change Summary
====================================

BEFORE                               AFTER
------                               -----
Ubuntu instructions, but broken      No Ubuntu (for now)

Copy & paste yum repo,               "yum install" repos from Euca server
but out of date    

"yum install" long list of           "yum-builddep eucalyptus"
out-of-date build dependencies       (no list to maintain)

"yum install" long list of           1-line script to parse our RPM
out-of-date runtime dependencies     eucalyptus.spec and "yum install" them
                                     (no list to maintain)

"configure" script with              "configure" not necessary anymore
out-of-date CLI options

Use "make [install]" which builds    Use "rpmbuild" which builds RPM
file tree only                       packages too

Output file tree is incomplete,      "rpmbuild" puts all files into its
some files installed to system       self-contained output tree
tree instead

Can only rsync the partial tree      rsync the RPMs to other systems
to other systems for install

"make install" does not do all       "yum install" of RPMs does everything
actions "rpmbuild" does, and
those steps not documented

Configuration has some different     No differences, follow Install Guide
steps from Install Guide             except for "yum install"s of RPMs

Operational differences from         No differences
how packaged installs work
{noformat}
fields.summary: Fix INSTALL file's instructions to build and deploy from source

comments.body:
I've committed my changes so far, to the INSTALL file. Commit c3e51cb.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/c3e51cb99fcc0546ad5e78522e844de41a427a8c

As the commit comment says:
"Sections 5 through 7 (Distribute, Configure and Run) still need more validation and corrections."

I've validated through step 4 ("make install" finishes).

My env:
CentOS v6.7 Minimal edition, running in a VM under VMware Workstation 11, on Windows 7. 
I know this can run Eucalyptus because I've successfully installed and run FastStart in such a VM, including launching Linux instances I can log into. (Yes, VMs within the FastStart VM.)

I've defined: (per step 3)
export EUCALYPTUS="/opt/eucalyptus"
...because we need to isolate the file tree built by "make" so it can be rsync'd to the other nodes in the cloud.

However, I'm not sure that will work, because the "configure" script and/or "make ; make install" still creates files outside $EUCALYPTUS. I'm attaching that list of files here.

Anyway, I've followed the Install Guide at http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.0/#shared/install_section.html , configuring for EDGE mode, skipping the installs of the packages (yum install eucalyptus-___) since I've built the code from source instead.

I'm also attaching my /opt/eucalyptus/etc/eucalyptus/eucalyptus.conf file.

I also manually added the eucalyptus group and user, which I think is required when not installing from packages: (not mentioned in the user docs, not sure it should be)

{noformat}
groupadd -g 700 -r eucalyptus
useradd -c "Eucalyptus Daemon User" -d /opt/eucalyptus/var/lib/eucalyptus -g 700 -r -u 600 eucalyptus
{noformat}

The init command failed with:

{noformat}
# /opt/eucalyptus/usr/sbin/clcadmin-initialize-cloud
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/eucalyptus/usr/sbin/clcadmin-initialize-cloud", line 28, in <module>
    import argparse
ImportError: No module named argparse
{noformat}

I also tried: (I don't know if euca_conf is still supported)

{noformat}
# euca_conf
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/eucalyptus/usr/sbin/euca_conf", line 44, in <module>
    from boto.roboto.awsqueryservice import NoCredentialsError
ImportError: No module named boto.roboto.awsqueryservice
{noformat}

I'm guessing this is related to installing into the non-standard $EUCALYPTUS directory (/opt/eucalyptus). 
If true, then either:
# We have to figure out if/how to fix support for non-standard $EUCALYPTUS installs (maybe a separate JIRA issue), or 
# We ditch that support, only support installing into '/', and replace the INSTALL step about rsync-ing the $EUCALYPTUS tree to other nodes, with the need to build the code from source on each node of your cloud.
# Or some other option?

I copied the contents of $EUCALYPTUS/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages into /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages and tried again, but no luck.

If my current errors are fixable another way, hopefully someone can assist me here. Not sure JIRA is the forum for low-level config/debugging, but you can find me as lincolnt on IRC, or email lincoln.thomas@hpe.com.

My problems with missing python packages were solved by installing the runtime dependencies which I had accidentally skipped.

...but then received the error:

{noformat}
# clcadmin-initialize-cloud
2015-12-11 13:38:39 INFO ulimit: resource=7 soft=1024 hard=4096
2015-12-11 13:38:39 INFO ulimit: resource=7 soft=65535 hard=65535
2015-12-11 13:38:39 INFO ulimit: resource=6 soft=15176 hard=15176
2015-12-11 13:38:39 INFO ulimit: resource=6 soft=-1 hard=-1
2015-12-11 13:38:40 ERROR 0715 Can't find library directory //usr/share/eucalyptus
2015-12-11 13:38:40 ERROR 0581 Service exit with a return value of 1.
/opt/eucalyptus/usr/sbin/clcadmin-initialize-cloud: cloud initialization failed
{noformat}

So, it's not properly looking in $EUCALYPTUS for the share files.

Giving up on keeping everything in $EUCALYPTUS, I copied the $EUCALYPTUS dirs into '/' with the command:

{{rsync -Kav $EUCALYPTUS/ /}}
(-K prevents the symlink {{/etc/init.d}} from being deleted/overwritten, and the slashes matter).

It apparently got further:

{noformat}
# clcadmin-initialize-cloud
2015-12-14 00:25:35 INFO ulimit: resource=7 soft=1024 hard=4096
2015-12-14 00:25:35 INFO ulimit: resource=7 soft=65535 hard=65535
2015-12-14 00:25:35 INFO ulimit: resource=6 soft=15176 hard=15176
2015-12-14 00:25:35 INFO ulimit: resource=6 soft=-1 hard=-1
2015-12-14 00:25:35 INFO User did not set heap size. Setting it automatically to 2GB base on total memory of 4002971648 bytes
2015-12-14 00:25:59 INFO Executing Pre-Shutdown Hooks...
2015-12-14 00:25:59 INFO Executing Shutdown Hooks...
2015-12-14 00:25:59 INFO Executing Post-Shutdown Hooks...
2015-12-14 00:25:59 INFO Executing Post-Shutdown Hook: com.eucalyptus.system.Threads$ThreadPool$1@12b94a8f
2015-12-14 00:25:59 INFO SHUTDOWN:Eucalyptus.SYSTEM Stopping thread pool...
2015-12-14 00:25:59 INFO Reloading service.
2015-12-14 00:25:59 INFO ulimit: resource=7 soft=1024 hard=4096
2015-12-14 00:25:59 INFO ulimit: resource=7 soft=65535 hard=65535
2015-12-14 00:25:59 INFO ulimit: resource=6 soft=15176 hard=15176
2015-12-14 00:25:59 INFO ulimit: resource=6 soft=-1 hard=-1
2015-12-14 00:25:59 INFO User did not set heap size. Setting it automatically to 2GB base on total memory of 4002971648 bytes
2015-12-14 00:26:12 INFO Executing Pre-Shutdown Hooks...
2015-12-14 00:26:12 INFO Executing Shutdown Hooks...
2015-12-14 00:26:12 INFO Executing Post-Shutdown Hooks...
2015-12-14 00:26:12 INFO Executing Post-Shutdown Hook: com.eucalyptus.system.Threads$ThreadPool$1@435041dd
2015-12-14 00:26:12 INFO SHUTDOWN:Eucalyptus.SYSTEM Stopping thread pool...
2015-12-14 00:26:12 INFO Reloading service.
{noformat}
...but kept looping that set of messages forever. 
Looking in {{/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-error.log}}, i see error such as:

{noformat}
Sun Dec 13 17:55:41 2015 ERROR [PEMFiles:main] [com.eucalyptus.crypto.util.PEMFiles.write(PEMFiles.java):120] java.io.FileNotFoundException: /var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/cloud-cert.pem (Permission denied)
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/cloud-cert.pem (Permission denied)
        at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method)
        at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:221)
        at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:110)
        at java.io.FileWriter.<init>(FileWriter.java:63)
        at com.eucalyptus.crypto.util.PEMFiles.write(PEMFiles.java:115)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.auth.SystemCredentials.create(SystemCredentials.java:244)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.auth.SystemCredentials.initialize(SystemCredentials.java:279)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.auth.SystemCredentials$initialize.call(Unknown Source)
        at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.CallSiteArray.defaultCall(CallSiteArray.java:48)
        at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.call(AbstractCallSite.java:113)
        at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.call(AbstractCallSite.java:117)
        at Script3.run(Script3.groovy:99)
        at org.codehaus.groovy.jsr223.GroovyScriptEngineImpl.eval(GroovyScriptEngineImpl.java:352)
        at org.codehaus.groovy.jsr223.GroovyScriptEngineImpl.eval(GroovyScriptEngineImpl.java:153)
        at org.codehaus.groovy.jsr223.GroovyScriptEngineImpl.eval(GroovyScriptEngineImpl.java:130)
        at com.eucalyptus.scripting.Groovyness.run(Groovyness.java:158)
        at com.eucalyptus.scripting.Groovyness.run(Groovyness.java:175)
        at com.eucalyptus.scripting.Groovyness.run(Groovyness.java:179)
        at com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.Bootstrap.initializeSystem(Bootstrap.java:620)
        at com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper.load(SystemBootstrapper.java:220)
{noformat}

So, there's apparently more work to do, to get this to work.

This means we probably can't use the distribution method of built files currently shown in step 5 "Distribute the Build":
{{rsync -ar $EUCALYPTUS/ root@host-2:$EUCALYPTUS/}}

A builder would have to instead take the git tree of files after doing a "make", rsync that to the other hosts, and then do a "make install" on each host, which seems OK. I'll verify that.

By comparison, building/configuring via the INSTALL(ation Guide) worked fine, with some additional actions I did based on the from the {{Requires:}}, {{%install}} and {{%pre}} sections of the https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-rpmspec/master/eucalyptus.spec file, and a few changes to the Installation Guide I will work with the docs team to investigate and adjust. This spec file builds to '/', it doesn't use a non-'/' $EUCALYPTUS directory. So, the build on the first host seems to end up as a configurable cloud node, if we add the other steps done in the spec file. These same steps would have to be done on the other nodes as well.

Another option for the INSTALL instructions would be to:
# {{git clone git://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-rpmspec}}
# Create the SOURCES, BUILD, SPECS directories
# {{rpmbuild -bi eucalyptus.spec}}
That would perform all the actions that the package build does, but without installing any packages and still allowing build and deploy from source. Then we wouldn't have to duplicate all the steps done by the rpmbuild in text form in the INSTALL file and maintain them.

Investigation continues.

Yes, there are some bugs in the tools that are not picking up EUCALYPTUS from the environment properly. I've seen those in local source builds I have in /opt/eucalyptus on my laptop VM and desktop. There are workarounds, but we need to file some bugs in the tools to use the env properly.

The error of the looping "clcadmin-initialize-cloud" is now moved to EUCA-11367. 

In talking with [~zhill], it's not really necessary that we support building from source and installing it to a non-'/' $EUCALYPTUS anyway, so we're going to describe only $EUCALYPTUS=/ in the INSTALL file (for now).

The remaining issue is completing all the extra actions performed by the {{eucalyptus.spec}} for build, install, pre and post actions. We can copy them into the INSTALL file, or document a way for users to run the rpmbuild command pieces, or something else. Investigation continues.
The error of clcadmin-initialize-cloud not finding the binary share files in $EUCALYPTUS=/opt/eucalyptus is now moved to EUCA-11825.

I have completed and tested a new INSTALL file that describes how to:
# set up a bare Minimal version of CentOS/RHEL v6.7 with all required dependencies, 
# get and build the source code, 
# distribute the built files to the other systems that comprise the cloud,
# install Eucalyptus on each system, including the build system if desired,
# re-make the code and replace files or re-install on all systems.

I'm attaching the INSTALL file here for review. I'll commit it to master and maint-42 on Tue Dec 22 incorporating any feedback I receive, if there are no issues preventing it.

Thanks to [~gholms], [~zhill], [~jbreiding], [~tony], and others for their help!

I'd also like [~kmeredith] to review the INSTALL file if time permits, for tech doc style and accuracy.
[^INSTALL_lincolnt_7]

Is it really necessary to add some of these environment variables to the .bashrc? I think it might be simpler to define all of these into a .eucabuildrc and just source that file or add it to the .bashrc. Perhaps having a subsection just for setting of the environment instead of doing it along the way. Then a subsection for just downloading the rpms, repos and shell scripts. There aren't many places where those parts would be optional. This would leave the rest to just executing commands on the system.

>> ([~lincoln.thomas]) Yes, I'll improve that.

I would rather see this instruction...
export EUCARUNDEP=$(cat $EUCAGIT/eucalyptus-rpmspec/eucalyptus_rundep)
yum install $EUNCARUNDEP

be replaced with the following...
cat $EUCAGIT/eucalyptus-rpmspec/eucalyptus_rundep | xargs yum -y install

>> The reason for saving the output to a file was so the other systems can install those dependencies by yum reading this file, which is rsync'd along with the RPMs, so you don't have to access github (or have git installed at all) to get the rpmspec on those systems. 

I think a little more structuring for this file is needed, mainly around numbering the sections and bullet the actual tasks so they don't get lost.

>> Yes, will do.

I myself glossed over the install of euca2ools install part which I only noticed after the attempt of installing the locally built rpms.

These steps added did in fact complete and I was able to install all of the rpms.

>> Hooray! Thanks for running through it.

Good ideas [~jbreiding], thanks! I'll do some updates to the INSTALL file.
I edited your comment for my responses inline.

Sorry perhaps I wasn't clear with regards to $EUCARUNDEP. I was just suggesting that instead of storing the results of file contents in an environment variable just pipe to yum install.

I do agree that storing the dependencies in a file for distribution is a good and necessary step.
Ah, got it, my misunderstanding. Will do.

[^INSTALL_lincolnt_9_with_Jeremy_feedback] 
Improvements from [~jbreiding] feedback.
Final INSTALL file committed to maint-4.2, security-4.2, and master (per team's branch commit process). Considering this issue resolved.

Reports have come from external developers about problems related to the $EUCALYPTUS variable (used by "make" described in the INSTALL file) interfering with clcadmin-initialize-cloud if you install the rpmbuild-built packages on the build system, which is a supported use case in the INSTALL file. I verified the problem in my testing.

There are other questions by external users about the need to install all build and runtime dependencies on all servers.

Fixed and committed to master and maint-4.2.
There will be more changes to handle RHEL7 and other 4.3 changes (most likely), so devs on the 4.2 branch can use this file while devs on master can use the master file we'll update as we go along.

Changes include:
* $EUCALYPTUS is now always "/", and is only defined for those doing "make" commands after previous rpmbuilds.
* Clarified up front for what use cases you would want to use this process.
* Found a process requiring only build (not runtime) dependencies to be installed on the build system, and neither build nor runtime dependencies to be installed on the other systems. The Eucalyptus packages will install the required runtime dependencies as they are installed by yum. Simplifies the process by removing some steps.
* Consolidated some sequential commands into one copy & paste-able command with "&&"s.
* Clarified the need to follow the prerequisite steps in the Install Guide before installing packages.
* Other clarifications.

Added step to remove previous rpmbuild artifacts.
Added "make" options to build for RHEL 6 vs 7, which applies only to master.

Also in yesterday's commit, changed the "configure" script to add a new var $EUCASTART that defines whether to build for RHEL v6 or v7, using either "enable-sysvinit" or "enable-systemd" flags per [~gholms]'s new feature.

...and changed where it gets the WSDL file in the ./configure command. No longer in the rpmspec repo, now in the eucalyptus repo at eucalyptus/devel/euca-WSDL2C.sh. Removed the no longer needed symlink step for the WSDL file to the rpmspec dir.

Community users/developers may be better off using the latest official release (4.2.1 as of now) as a stable code base (instead of master) to experiment with changing source code. So, I have updated https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/maint-4.2/INSTALL to clarify the build instructions for the maint-4.2 branch. 
•	It was pointing to the nightly repos instead of the 4.2.x released repos in some cases. 
•	It needed the git checkout commands to use the maint-4.2 branches. 
•	I added --nogpgcheck to certain yum install commands. 
The diffs are here:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/f6afe882427b808c362916c2dfc311281e110255
Use these instructions to build from source for the released 4.2.1 code.

Announced these changes to the community user trying to do this, and CC'd euca-users@eucalyptus.com .
